synopsis: In episode #12 of PBR, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome Valante, a talented music producer and teacher, who shares his inspiring journey from childhood struggles to creative expression. The conversation delves into the importance of authenticity, the beauty of simply existing, and the transformative power of music.
quotes: Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
It's difficult to not project your idea of someone onto them.
I could just lay on the bed and be like, why doesn't everybody just lay on the bed? This is the greatest thing ever.
You can really change the world in small ways, I believe.
It's a fine line between survivor's guilt and a savior complex.
I always felt very safe and taken care of by all older people around me.
It just feels so significant losing that person because it almost feels like... I can't have everything.
You can expect music. That's it. There's no plan.
If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
This is perfect music to exist to.
